private_information: I can reason about recursive strategies for Tower of Hanoi
I can produce a high level sequence of moves expressed as ordered pairs (from_peg, to_peg) and subtask decompositions
I know there are 7 disks labeled A (smallest) through G (largest)
plan_generator.goal: Transform the stack of 7 disks from the left peg to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules and leaving the middle peg empty

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency checking
I detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as token counters or post-hoc penalties that mask illegal moves
I ensure that each move moves only the top disk of a peg and never places a larger disk onto a smaller disk
auditor.goal: Audit the plan for temporal and causal correctness and produce a corrected, bookkeeping-free plan or a report of violations

private_information: I integrate analyses and produce a final PDDL domain and problem aimed at the FastDownwards planner
I must keep agent actions distinct when translating into a multi-agent or single-agent planning representation
orchestrator.goal: Produce a correct PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance with 7 disks, 3 pegs, initial and goal configurations, and constraints suitable for FastDownwards

public_information: Puzzle: Tower of Hanoi with 3 pegs named left, middle, right
Action available: Move the top disk from one peg to another peg
Rules: Only one disk may be moved at a time
Rules: A move may only remove the top disk from a peg
Rules: A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Rules: Once a disk is moved it preserves relative size ordering with the others
Initial state: left peg holds from top to bottom disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, disk G
Initial state: middle peg is empty
Initial state: right peg is empty
Goal state: right peg must hold from top to bottom disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, disk G
Goal state: left peg and middle peg must be empty
Note: Middle peg may be used as an intermediate but must end empty

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert planner for combinatorial puzzles. Produce a clear high-level plan for solving Tower of Hanoi with 7 disks. Do not emit PDDL. Provide an ordered list of moves and a recursive decomposition into subtasks. Indicate assumptions you rely on and note any ambiguous naming or representation choices.
analysis.prompt: Your role is plan_generator. Use the public information about the environment and your private knowledge to produce a high level move sequence and a recursive decomposition for moving 7 disks from left to right using middle as auxiliary. Express moves as ordered pairs like (left,right). Highlight explicit constraints that must be respected by any executable plan.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency for plans. You do not produce PDDL. Instead you inspect a provided plan for illegal moves, concurrency or bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce either a corrected move sequence or a structured report listing violations and required corrections.
audit.prompt: Your role is auditor. Receive the high level plan produced by plan_generator and check every move for compliance with Tower of Hanoi rules. Identify any steps that rely on shortcuts such as combining moves, using tokens, or assuming non-top removals. Produce either a corrected canonical move sequence without bookkeeping shortcuts or a detailed report of why the plan is invalid.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the Tower of Hanoi instance with 7 disks and 3 pegs. Ensure the domain enforces single-disk moves, top-disk-only moves, and the cannot-place-larger-on-smaller constraint. Keep action names unambiguous and include typing or predicates as needed for FastDownwards compatibility. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards by keeping the domain STRIPS-compatible and avoiding constructs unsupported by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Your role is orchestrator. Integrate the high level plan and the auditor report. Resolve any naming mismatches and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that represent the initial and goal configurations exactly as specified in the public information. Preserve distinctions between the analyses of other agents and do not conflate their internal representations. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
